dragon.infrastructure.node_desc

A class that uniquely defines properties of a managed hardware node for infrastructure communication.

This is a stub at the moment, and should be extended for dynamic hardware allocations/elasticity aka The Cloud (TM) and more complex node properties (accelerators, networks, encryption).

classmethod make_for_current_node(name: Optional[str] = None, ip_addrs: Optional[list[str]] = None, is_primary: bool = False)

Create a serialized node descriptor for the node this Shepherd is running on. Can only be used to send to GS, as h_uid will be None in the descriptor.

Parameters

  • name (str, optional) – hostname of this node, defaults to None

  • ip_addrs (list[str], optional) – List of the IP addresses for this node, defaults to [“127.0.0.1”]

  • is_primary (bool, optional) – denote if this is the primary node running GS, defaults to False

Returns

serialized Node descruptor

Return type

dict

Parameters
